newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: At least seven Moslem rebels killed in Philippines.
newsitem.headline: At least seven Moslem rebels killed in Philippines.

text.p: At least seven Moslem rebels were killed and six soldiers seriously wounded in fresh skirmishes in the southern Philippines, the military said on Friday.

Two armed helicopters backed up soldiers as they moved into a suspected stronghold of the Abu Sayyaf rebel group in Lantawan on the island of Basilan on Thursday, Lieutenant General Romeo Padiernos told reporters.
The deaths bring to 14 the number of rebels killed in the government offensive since Tuesday, added Padiernos, who is head of the military's Southern Command.
"The offensive will continue and we will press them to their limits until we flush out all the lawless groups in Basilan," he said.
Abu Sayyaf is the more extreme of two Moslem groups still fighting waging separatist wars in the south of the archipelago. The military is also battling the Moro Islamic Liberation Front.

On nearby Mindanao, the largest island in the southern Philippines, the government last September signed a peace deal with the leading Moslem separatist group, the Moro National Liberation Front (MNLF).
